src:
Keiko Fujimori no participará en las elecciones legislativas peruanas

03 Nov 2019, 11:52


La líder opositora peruana Keiko Fujimori anunció “de manera clara y directa” que no participará en las elecciones legislativas del próximo 26 de enero en su país.




“Frente a las especulaciones de una posible candidatura mía al Congreso, quiero expresar de manera clara y directa que no participaré en este proceso electoral”, señaló Fujimori en un mensaje publicado en su cuenta en la red social Twitter.
La líder del partido Fuerza Popular cumple desde hace un año una orden de prisión preventiva durante 18 meses mientras es investigada por presunto lavado de activos por haber recibido financiación supuestamente irregular para sus campañas electorales.
Ya que la ley peruana le permite participar en los comicios, por no existir una condena en su contra, en las últimas semanas se ha especulado sobre la posibilidad de que participe en las elecciones convocadas después de que el presidente Martín Vizcarra disolvió el Congreso el 30 de septiembre pasado.
Tras salir al paso a esos comentarios, Fujimori sostuvo que su “prioridad en este momento” es su familia, su salud, fortalecer a su partido “y seguir dando la cara ante la justicia” porque “sabe” que es inocente.
A pesar de su rechazo a las imputaciones en su contra, la Fiscalía acusa a la excandidata de presidencial de haber formado una organización criminal en el seno de Fuerza Popular para blanquear dinero recibido irregularmente de la empresa brasileña Odebrecht.
LUCHAN POR SU INOCENCIA
Su defensa insiste en su inocencia y clama para que recupere su libertad, pero de momento solo ha obtenido una reducción de la prisión preventiva de 36 a 18 meses, con lo que podría salir en libertad el 30 de abril de 2020, si es que la Fiscalía no presenta una acusación formal en su contra antes.
Además, el Tribunal Constitucional debe debatir y resolver en las próximas semanas un recurso que pide su liberación por presuntas irregularidades en la decisión judicial que ordenó su prisión preventiva.
Los dirigentes de Fuerza Popular acordaron el pasado fin de semana que su partido participará en las próximas elecciones parlamentarias, a pesar de que han mantenido una pública oposición a la disolución del Congreso, que dominaban con amplia mayoría, y acusan al presidente Vizcarra de ser un dictador.

EFE
text:
Keiko Fujimori will not participate in the Peruvian legislative elections

03 Nov 2019, 11:52


Peruvian opposition leader Keiko Fujimori announced “clearly and directly” that she will not participate in the legislative elections on January 26 in her country.




"Faced with the speculation of a possible candidacy of mine for Congress, I want to express clearly and directly that I will not participate in this electoral process," Fujimori said in a message posted on his account on the social network Twitter.
The leader of the Fuerza Popular party has been carrying out a preventive detention order for 18 months while it is being investigated for alleged money laundering for having received allegedly irregular funding for its electoral campaigns.
Since Peruvian law allows him to participate in the elections, because there is no condemnation against him, in recent weeks there has been speculation about the possibility of participating in the elections called after President Martín Vizcarra dissolved the Congress on 30 last September.
After stepping up to those comments, Fujimori said his "priority at this time" is his family, his health, strengthening his party "and continuing to face justice" because he "knows" that he is innocent.
Despite its rejection of the charges against him, the Prosecutor's Office accuses the former presidential candidate of having formed a criminal organization within the Popular Force to launder money received irregularly from the Brazilian company Odebrecht.
FIGHT FOR YOUR INNOCENCE
His defense insists on his innocence and calls for him to recover his freedom, but for the moment he has only obtained a reduction in pretrial detention from 36 to 18 months, which could result in his release on April 30, 2020, if the Prosecutor does not file a formal accusation against him before.
In addition, the Constitutional Court must debate and resolve in the coming weeks an appeal that asks for his release due to alleged irregularities in the judicial decision that ordered his preventive detention.
The leaders of the Popular Force agreed last weekend that their party will participate in the next parliamentary elections, although they have maintained a public opposition to the dissolution of Congress, which they dominated with a large majority, and accuse President Vizcarra of being a dictator.

EFE
